intro: Geniostoma myrtifolium var. minor, commonly known as the lesser myrtleleaf geniostoma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
